name: swan

attributes.attribute: lucky to see seven swans flying
seven years of good luck would follow
seeing a multiple of seven brought that many more years of good luck
Hurting or killing a swan brought bad luck to oneself and one’s entire community

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Folklore speaks of the swan as a significant animal, often witnessed as a human who has undergone a transformation, akin to the Seal. On occasion, it was believed that a swan could be a cursed nun. It was considered auspicious to witness seven swans soaring through the sky, signifying seven years of good fortune. If multiple swans were sighted, the good luck multiplied by the number of birds seen. However, if one were to harm or kill a swan, it would bring misfortune not only to themselves but to their community as a whole. To learn more about the swan, refer to Swan Maiden.
